title: Behind the blog, intro
body: Somewhere, deep in the recesses of my mind, there's a post begging to be written about the human element behind this entire venture. How it feels to be stuck in St. Louis when I know we should be in Springfield. The exhilarating optimism-fueled days when everything seems to be going our way, and the other days, the ones I never talk about, when the entire project feels like it's slipping away. That's what I wanted to write about tonight, but I could't seem to find the words.
author: Dan

comments.author: Newell
comments.body: Maybe the words are in the same place as your hat.

comments.author: Nicole
comments.body: Cheer up Charlie! Just be glad you're you...and that we don't have work on Monday!

comments.author: einahpets
comments.body: Whoa. That's weird. I was just going to write Cheer up Charlie..just be glad you're you...that was a weird twin moment.

comments.author: Oz
comments.body:
You should totally write about the times you think the whole thing is slipping away.  "This blog is intended to chronicle the process of developing, financing, starting, and maintaining a small, independently-owned, art-house theater."  I didn't read anything in that which specifies "only the good, positive parts of...."

Or is this some sort of macho crap where you can't show your insecurities?

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: It's some sort of macho crap where I can't show my insecurities, or reveal that I wet the bed... wait. Damn it!

comments.author: Oz
comments.body: I knew it!  I placed two bets when I started reading this blog.  1) The theater is in Missouri.  2)  Dan is a bed wetter.  Watch out, Vegas, I'm coming to collect.
